title.narrative: COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT TO PREVENT DISCRIMINATION AND DROPOUT

description.narrative: By 2023, SMCs are other duty-bearers increasingly involved in management and are accountable to prevent discrimination and dropout, particularly with regard to the most vulnerable children including in emergencies., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, more preschool and school aged children benefit from an equitable, inclusive, quality education and acquire the necessary skills to continue their education or integrate into the labour market

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2023, SMCs are other duty-bearers increasingly involved in management and are accountable to prevent discrimination and dropout,particularly with regard to the most vulnerable children including in emergencies.

description.narrative: The year 2021 was characterized by a general commitment to the back-to-school campaign with a focus on the distribution of school supplies and in particular, the identification of the most vulnerable children to benefit from these supplies. Some 2,585,653 students (1,310,847 girls) throughout the country received school supplies and 38, 300 classrooms were equipped with teaching materials. Some 179,801 (91,699 girls) returnees, Internal Displaced Persons (IDPs) and other vulnerable children were re-integrated in schools and 1,332 school committee members were trained on school management, school safety and monitoring learning outcomes. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:10/01/2022
